trans-unit.source: Uses Windows authentication to authenticate the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class to authenticate security tokens that derive from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsSecurityTokenAuthenticator"></xref> class.

When the user is authenticated, claims that identify the Windows groups that a user belongs to are initially added to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Policy.EvaluationContext.ClaimSets%2A> property and eventually to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Policy.AuthorizationContext.ClaimSets%2A> property.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsSecurityTokenAuthenticator"></xref> class by specifying whether the groups that the Windows user belongs to are added to the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.AuthorizationContext.ClaimSets"></xref> property when the user is authenticated.
`true` to get the groups the Windows user belongs to; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified security token can be validated by this security token authenticator.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsSecurityTokenAuthenticator.CanValidateTokenCore%2A> method does not authenticate the security token; that is performed by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateTokenCore%2A> method.
`true` when token is a security token; otherwise, `false`.
Authenticates the specified security token and returns the set of authorization policies for the security token.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy"></xref> that contains the set of authorization policies in effect for this application.
